contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Prime Minister | name = Giovanni Berlinguer [[Member of the European Parliament|MEP]] | image = Giovanni Berlinguer 2008byFigiu.jpg | order = [[Member of the European Parliament]] | constituency = [[European Parliament Election, 2004 (Italy)#Seats|North-East]] | term_start = 14 June 2004 | term_end = 2009 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1924|7|9|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Sassari]], [[Italy]] | nationality = [[Italians|Italian]] | alma_mater = | profession = [[University Professor]] | children = | spouse = | residence = | party = [[Democratici di Sinistra]] }} '''Giovanni Berlinguer''' ({{IPA-it|berliŋˈɡwɛr}}), [[Italian orders of merit|Cavaliere di Gran Croce OMRI]]<ref>[http://www.quirinale.it/elementi/Onorificenze.aspx?pag=0&qIdOnorificenza=&cognome=Berlinguer&nome=Giovanni&daAnno=1800&aAnno=2013&luogoNascita=&testo=&ordinamento=OCO_ANNO_DECRETO%20DESC,OCO_MESE_DECRETO%20DESC,OCO_GIORNO_DECRETO%20DESC quirinale.it]</ref> (born 9 July 1924), is an [[Italy|Italian]] politician and Professor of [[Social medicine|Social Medicine]]. He was born in [[Sassari]], [[Sardinia]], the son of [[Mario Berlinguer]]. Like his brother [[Enrico Berlinguer|Enrico]], Giovanni Berlinguer was a major figure in the [[Italian Communist Party]] (PCI) and was elected to the [[Chamber of Deputies of Italy|Chamber of Deputies]] in 1972, 1976 and 1979 and to the [[Italian Senate|Senate]] in 1983 and 1987. He ran for the secretarship of the [[Democrats of the Left]] (DS) in 2001, being defeated by [[Piero Fassino]] 61.8% to 34.1%. From 2004 to 2009 he was a [[Member of the European Parliament]] representing the DS and sits with the [[Party of European Socialists]] group. At the convening of the [[European Parliament|Parliament]] on 20 July 2004 he was found to be the [[Father of the House#European Union|oldest member]], and as such presided over the Parliament during the election of [[Josep Borrell Fontelles]] in 2004 and [[Hans-Gert Pöttering]] in 2007 as [[President of the European Parliament|President of the Parliament]]. ==See also== * [[European Parliament election, 2004 (Italy)]] *{{EP MEP info/6th term|28369|of Giovanni Berlinguer}} *{{Declaration of financial interests of the 6th term|28369_06-07-2004.PDF|it}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Members of the European Parliament 2004–2009}} {{Authority control|VIAF=59123489|GND=171691814|LCCN=n/79/58925}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Berlinguer, Giovanni | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =University Professor, politician | DATE OF BIRTH =9 July 1924 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Sassari]], [[Italy]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Berlinguer, Giovanni}} [[Category:1924 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Sassari]] [[Category:Italian Communist Party politicians]] [[Category:Democratic Party (Italy) MEPs]] [[Category:MEPs for Italy 2004–2009]] [[Category:Democrats of the Left politicians]] [[Category:Members of the Italian Chamber of Deputies]] [[Category:Members of the Italian Senate]] {{Italy-MEP-stub}}
